          <h2>
           Search Google Scholar for Articles
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_20" id="content10101170">
          <div id="boxatt10101170" class="boxatt">
           <label for="searchText10101170">
            <img alt="Google Scholar Logo" src="http://lgimages.s3.amazonaws.com/google_scholar.jpg" />
           </label>
           <br />
           <input type="text" value="" id="searchText10101170" class="google_search_box" title="Google scholar search" />
           <br />
           <input type="button" onclick="var queryString = document.getElementById('searchText10101170').value;queryString = queryString.replace(/\\+/g, '+');var url = 'http://scholar.google.com/scholar?q=' + queryString;window.open(url,'GScholar');" value="Search" />

     <div id="contentcenter" style="width:520px;padding-left:0px; margin-left:0px; margin-right:8px; float:left;">
      <div id="centerboxes">
       <div id="wrapbox18321775">
        <div class="roundbox outerbox" id="18321775">
         <div class="roundbox headerbox" id="title18321775">
          <div class="bi_text">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           Mapping the Muhlenberg Landscape--Border, Boundaries, and Barriers (September 8)
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_1" id="content18321775">
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works on Muhlenberg Spaces
           </strong>
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           Community design. (2003).
           <em>
            American
           </em>
           <em>
            School
           </em>
           <em>
            &amp; University, 75
           </em>
           (10), 14-15. Retrieved May 21, 2009, from
           <a href="http://0-search.ebscohost.com.library.muhlenberg.edu/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=10175751&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
            http://0-search.ebscohost.com.library.muhlenberg.edu/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=10175751&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           Tripaldi, M.S. (2003).
           <em>
            Muhlenberg&rsquo;s living stones: The glory of God in the Egner Memorial Chapel. &nbsp;&nbsp;
            <br />
           </em>
           <a href="http://library.muhlenberg.edu/record=b1460408">
            Trexler Library Main Collection 726.509748 T835m
           </a>
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           Wiewel, W. &amp; Knaap, G. (Eds.). (2005).
           <em>
            Partnerships for smart growth:&nbsp; University-community collaboration for better public places
           </em>
           .&nbsp; Armonk, N.Y.: M.E. Sharpe; Cambridge, MA: Lincoln Institute of Land Policy.
           <br />
           <a href="http://library.muhlenberg.edu/record=b1500317">
            Trexler Library Main Collection 378.103 W652p
           </a>
          </p>
          <div id="boxatt18321775" class="boxatt">
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div id="wrapbox18321781">
        <div class="roundbox outerbox" id="18321781">
         <div class="roundbox headerbox" id="title18321781">
          <div class="bi_text">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           Lady Pink (September 22)
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_1" id="content18321781">
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works by Lady Pink
           </strong>
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            Lady Pink&rsquo;s MySpace page with photos of her art. Retrieved May 21, 2009, from
            <a href="http://www.myspace.com/pinksmith7">
             http://www.myspace.com/pinksmith7
            </a>
            .
           </p>
           <p>
            Web page of Lady Pink. Retrieved May 14, 2009, from
            <a href="http://www.pinksmith.com/">
             http://www.pinksmith.com/
            </a>
            .
           </p>
          </blockquote>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works about Lady Pink
           </strong>
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            Johnson, K. (2006, June 30). Aerosol outlaws, suddenly on the inside track.
            <em>
             The New York Times
            </em>
            . Retrieved May 14, 2009, from
            <a href="http://www.nytimes.com/">
             http://www.nytimes.com
            </a>
            .
           </p>
           <p>
            Q &amp; A with Lady Pink supporting her exhibition &lsquo;Graffiti&rsquo; at the Brooklyn Museum. Retrieved May 14, 2009, from
            <a href="http://www.brooklynmuseum.org/exhibitions/graffiti/ladypink.php">
             http://www.brooklynmuseum.org/exhibitions/graffiti/ladypink.php
            </a>
            .
           </p>
           <p>
            Siegel, F. (1993, March/April). Lady Pink: Graffiti with feminist intent.
            <em>
             Ms., 3
            </em>
            (5)
            <em>
             ,
            </em>
            66-69.
            <br />
            <a href="http://library.muhlenberg.edu/record=b1060379">
             Trexler Library Periodicals Level C
            </a>
           </p>
          </blockquote>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works about Graffiti Art
           </strong>
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           <em>
            Art Crimes
           </em>
           (an online gallery of graffiti from artists around the globe).&nbsp; Retrieved May 14, 2009, from
           <a href="http://artcrimes.com/">
            http://artcrimes.com/
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           Austin, J. (2001).
           <em>
            Taking the train: How graffiti art became an urban crisis in New York City.
           </em>
           New York: Columbia University Press.
           <br />
           <a href="http://library.muhlenberg.edu/record=b1742061">
            Trexler Library Main Collection 751.73097471 A936t
           </a>
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           Chalfant, H.&nbsp; (1987).&nbsp;
           <em>
            Spraycan art
           </em>
           .&nbsp; New York:&nbsp; Thames &amp; Hudson.
           <br />
           <a href="http://library.muhlenberg.edu/record=b1742063">
            Trexler Library Main Collection 751.7309048 C436s
           </a>
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           Powers, L.A. (1996). Whatever happened to the graffiti art movement?&nbsp;
           <em>
            Journal of Popular Culture, 29
           </em>
           (4)137-142. Retrieved May 14, 2009, from
           <a href="http://0-search.ebscohost.com.library.muhlenberg.edu/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=9701110119&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
            http://0-search.ebscohost.com.library.muhlenberg.edu/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=9701110119&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           Reiss, J. (2008).
           <em>
            Bomb it: Street art is revolution
           </em>
           [DVD]. A Flying Cow production in association with Antidote Films, Inc.
           <br />
           <a href="http://library.muhlenberg.edu/record=b1732222">
            Trexler Library AV Alcove 751.73 B695i
           </a>
          </p>
          <div id="boxatt18321781" class="boxatt">
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div id="wrapbox18321791">
        <div class="roundbox outerbox" id="18321791">
         <div class="roundbox headerbox" id="title18321791">
          <div class="bi_text">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           Sacred Spaces (October 5)
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_1" id="content18321791">
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works about Sacred Spaces
           </strong>
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           Arnold, P.P. &amp; Grodz, A. (2001).
           <em>
            Sacred landscapes and cultural politics: Planting a tree
           </em>
           . Burlington, VT: Ashgate.
           <br />
           <a href="http://library.muhlenberg.edu/record=b1420799">
            Trexler Library Main Collection 291.178363 A757s
           </a>
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           Burton, L. (2002).&nbsp;
           <em>
            Worship and wilderness: Culture, religion, and law in the management of public lands and resources
           </em>
           . Madison: University of Wisconsin Press.
           <br />
           <a href="http://library.muhlenberg.edu/record=b1456763">
            Trexler Library Main Collection 201.77 B974w
           </a>
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           Nelson, L.P. (Ed.) (2006).
           <em>
            American sanctuary: Understanding sacred spaces
           </em>
           . Bloomington: Indiana University Press.
           <br />
           <a href="http://library.muhlenberg.edu/record=b1592250">
            Trexler Library Main Collection 203.5 A512s&nbsp;
           </a>
           &nbsp;
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           Sacred places. (2007).
           <em>
            U.S. News &amp; World Report, 143
           </em>
           (19), 36-72. Retrieved May 21, 2009, from
           <a href="http://0-search.ebscohost.com.library.muhlenberg.edu/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=27558379&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
            http://0-search.ebscohost.com.library.muhlenberg.edu/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=27558379&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <div id="boxatt18321791" class="boxatt">
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div id="wrapbox18321797">
        <div class="roundbox outerbox" id="18321797">
         <div class="roundbox headerbox" id="title18321797">
          <div class="bi_text">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           Janisse Ray (October 20)
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_1" id="content18321797">
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works by Janisse Ray
           </strong>
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            The bleeding fields:&nbsp; Rural exodus and reinhabitation of the southlands (a personal narrative).&nbsp; Retrieved May 15, 2009, from
            <a href="http://www.yale.edu/agrarianstudies/papers/15bleeding.pdf">
             http://www.yale.edu/agrarianstudies/papers/15bleeding.pdf
            </a>
            .
           </p>
           <p>
            <em>
             Ecology of a cracker childhood
            </em>
            . (1999). Minneapolis:&nbsp; Milkweed Editions.
           </p>
           <p>
            <em>
             Pinhook: Finding wholeness in a fragmented land
            </em>
            . (2005). White River Junction, VT: Chelsea Green.
           </p>
           <p>
            Six poems. (2004).
            <em>
             Nantahala: A review of writing and photography in Appalachia, 2
            </em>
            (2). Retrieved May 15, 2009, from
            <a href="http://nantahalareview.org/issue2-2/poetry/RAY.htm">
             http://nantahalareview.org/issue2-2/poetry/RAY.htm
            </a>
            .
           </p>
           <p>
            <em>
             Wild card quilt: Taking a chance on home
            </em>
            . (2003). Minneapolis:&nbsp; Milkweed Editions.
           </p>
          </blockquote>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works about Janisse Ray
           </strong>
          </p>

            <em>
             DLA Ejournal, 50
            </em>
            (1). Retrieved May 15, 2009, from

            </em>

          <h2>
           Mindy Thompson Fullilove (October 26)
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_1" id="content18321811">

            Works by Mindy Thompson Fullilove
           </strong>

          <h2>
           Harvey Molotch (November 10)
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_1" id="content18321853">
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works by Harvey Molotch
           </strong>
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            Molotch, H., Freudenburg, W., &amp; Paulsen, K. (2000). History repeats itself, but how?: City character, urban tradition, and the accomplishment of place.
            <em>
             American Sociological Review
            </em>
            <em>
             , 65
            </em>
            , 791-823.&nbsp; Retrieved May 21, 2009, from
            <a href="http://0-www.jstor.org.library.muhlenberg.edu/stable/pdfplus/2657514.pdf">

           </p>

            </em>
            (1), 36-67.&nbsp; Retrieved May 15, 2009, from

            </a>

          <h2>
           Liz McCartney (November 16)
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_1" id="content18321862">
          <p>
           <strong>
            Commendations Awarded to Liz McCartney
           </strong>
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            Liz McCartney and Zack Rosenburg are chosen as Gambit's 2008 New Orleanians of the Year.
           </p>
           <p>
            Liz McCartney is voted
            <a href="http://www.cnn.com/SPECIALS/cnn.heroes/archive/liz.mccartney.html">
             2008 CNN Hero of the Yea
            </a>
            r.
           </p>
           <p>
            Liz McCartney and Zack Rosenburg receive a
            <a href="http://www.manhattan-institute.org/html/se_winners.htm">
             Social Entrepreneurship Award from the Manhattan Institute (2008)
            </a>
            .
           </p>
           <p>
            The St. Bernard Project receives
            <a href="http://www.friendsofneworleans.org/2008/05/sen_landrieu_pr.php">
             Hero Award from Friends of New Orleans
            </a>
            .
           </p>
          </blockquote>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works about Liz McCartney
           </strong>
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            CNN heroes. (2009, May 9).&nbsp; Retrieved May 21, 2009, from
            <a href="http://www.cnn.com/2008/LIVING/05/08/heroes.mccartney/index.html">
             http://www.cnn.com/2008/LIVING/05/08/heroes.mccartney/index.html
            </a>
            .
           </p>
           <p>
            Husock, H. (2008, October 21). Nobody does it better.
            <em>
             The Wall Street Journal
            </em>
            .&nbsp; Retrieved May 21, 2009, from
            <a href="http://www.wsj.com/">
             http://www.wsj.com
            </a>
            .
           </p>
           <p>
            Pais, N.B. (2009, January 5). Home builders.&nbsp;
            <em>
             Gambit
            </em>
            . Retrieved May 21, 2009, from
            <a href="http://bestofneworleans.com/gyrobase/Content?oid=oid%3A48772">
             http://bestofneworleans.com/gyrobase/Content?oid=oid%3A48772
            </a>
           </p>
           <p>
            St. Bernard Project. Retrieved May 21, 2009, from
            <a href="http://www.stbernardproject.org/">
             http://www.stbernardproject.org/
            </a>
            .
           </p>
          </blockquote>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works about Hurricane Katrina Disaster Recovery Efforts
           </strong>
          </p>

           <em>

           </em>
           Durham: Carolina Academic Press.
           <br />

          <h2>
           Paula Massood (February 10)
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_1" id="content18321913">
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works by Paula Massood
           </strong>
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            Massood, Paula J. "An Aesthetic Appropriate to Conditions:
            <em>
             Killer of Sheep
            </em>
            , (Neo)Realism, and the Documentary Impulse."
            <em>
             Wide Angle
            </em>
            21.4 (1999) 20-41.
            <em>
             Project Muse
            </em>
            . Web. 8 Feb. 2010.
            <a href="http://0-muse.jhu.edu.library.muhlenberg.edu/journals/wide_angle/v021/21.4massood.pdf">
             http://0-muse.jhu.edu.library.muhlenberg.edu/journals/wide_angle/v021/21.4massood.pdf
            </a>
           </p>
           <p>
            Massood, Paula.
            <em>
             Black City Cinema: African American Urban Experiences In Film.
            </em>
            Philadelphia: Temple University Press, 2003. Print.
            <br />
            <a href="http://library.muhlenberg.edu/search%7ES0?/amassood/amassood/1%2C1%2C2%2CB/frameset&amp;FF=amassood+paula+j+1965&amp;1%2C%2C2">
             Trexler Library Main Collection 791.43652 M421b
            </a>
           </p>
           <p>
            Massood, Paula. &ldquo;Ghetto Supastar: Warren Beatty&rsquo;s &lsquo;Bulworth&rsquo; and the Politics of Race and Space.&rdquo;
            <em>
             Literature Film Quarterly
            </em>
            30.4 (2002): 287-293.
            <em>
             Communication &amp; Mass Media Complete
            </em>
            . Web. January 13, 2010 from
            <a href="http://0-search.ebscohost.com.library.muhlenberg.edu/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=ufh&amp;AN=8948083&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
             http://0-search.ebscohost.com.library.muhlenberg.edu/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=ufh&amp;AN=8948083&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site
            </a>
           </p>
           <p>
            Massood, Paula. "Mapping the Hood: The Genealogy of City Space in
            <em>
             Boyz N the Hood
            </em>
            and
            <em>
             Menace II Society
            </em>
            ."
            <em>
             Cinema Journal
            </em>
            35.2 (Winter, 1996): 85-97.
            <em>
             JSTOR
            </em>
            . Web. 8 Feb. 2010.
            <a href="http://0-www.jstor.org.library.muhlenberg.edu/stable/1225757">
             http://0-www.jstor.org.library.muhlenberg.edu/stable/1225757
            </a>
           </p>
           <p>
            Massood, Paula, ed.
            <em>
             The Spike Lee Reader
            </em>
            . Philadelphia: Temple University Press, 2008. Print.
            <br />
            <a href="http://library.muhlenberg.edu/search%7ES0?/tspike+lee/tspike+lee/1%2C3%2C3%2CB/frameset&amp;FF=tspike+lee+reader&amp;1%2C1%2C">
             Trexler Library Main Collection 791.430233 L481zm
            </a>
           </p>
           <p>
            Massood, Paula J. "Which Way to the Promised Land?: Spike Lee's Clockers and the Legacy of the African American City."
            <em>
             African American Review
            </em>
            35.2 (2001): 263.
            <em>
             Academic Search Complete
            </em>
            . Web. 8 Feb. 2010.
            <a href="http://0-search.ebscohost.com.library.muhlenberg.edu/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=4952371&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
             http://0-search.ebscohost.com.library.muhlenberg.edu/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=4952371&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site
            </a>
           </p>
          </blockquote>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works about Paula Massood
           </strong>
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            "Paula Massood."
            <em>
             Brooklyn College
            </em>
            .&nbsp; 2010. Web. Januray 26, 2010.
            <a href="http://www.brooklyn.cuny.edu/pub/Faculty_Details5.jsp?faculty=3">
             http://www.brooklyn.cuny.edu/pub/Faculty_Details5.jsp?faculty=3
            </a>

            "Professor Paula J. Massood."&nbsp;

             Film Studies Certificate Program
            </em>
            .&nbsp;Graduate Center, City University of New York, 2010. Web. January 26, 2010.
            <a href="http://web.gc.cuny.edu/Filmstudies/faculty/massood.htm">
             http://web.gc.cuny.edu/Filmstudies/faculty/massood.htm
            </a>
           </p>
          </blockquote>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Other Works about the African American Urban Experience in Cinema
           </strong>
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            Leyda, Julia. &ldquo;Black-Audience Westerns and the Politics of Cultural Identification in the 1930s.&rdquo;
            <em>
             Cinema Journal
            </em>
            42.1 (Autumn 2002): 46-70.
            <em>
             JSTOR
            </em>

            </a>
           </p>
           <p>

            <em>
             Black Lenses, Black Voices: African American Film Now
            </em>
            . Lanham, MD: Rowman &amp; Littlefield, 2005.&nbsp; Print.
            <br />

             Trexler Library Main Collection &nbsp;791.43652 R357b
            </a>
            &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
           </p>
           <p>
            Stewart, Jacqueline. &ldquo;Negroes Laughing at Themselves? Black Spectatorship and the Performance of Urban Modernity.&rdquo;
            <em>
             Critical Inquiry
            </em>
            29.4 (2003): 650-677.
            <em>
             MLA International Bibliography
            </em>
            . Web. January 27, 2010.
            <a href="http://0-search.ebscohost.com.library.muhlenberg.edu/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=mzh&amp;AN=2003421051&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
             <br />
             http://0-search.ebscohost.com.library.muhlenberg.edu/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=mzh&amp;AN=2003421051&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site

          <h2>
           Li Zhang (February 17)
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_1" id="content18321933">
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works by Li Zhang
           </strong>
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            Zhang, Li. &ldquo;Contesting Spatial Modernity in Late Socialist China.&rdquo;
            <em>
             Current Anthropology
            </em>
            47.3 (June 2006): 461-484.
            <em>
             University of Chicago Press Journals
            </em>
            . Web. 5 Feb. 2010.
            <a href="http://0-www.journals.uchicago.edu.library.muhlenberg.edu/doi/full/10.1086/503063">
             http://0-www.journals.uchicago.edu.library.muhlenberg.edu/doi/full/10.1086/503063
            </a>
           </p>
           <p>
            Zhang, Li. &ldquo;Migration and Privatization of Space and Power in Late Socialist China.&rdquo;
            <em>
             American Ethnologist
            </em>
            28 (1): 179-205.
            <em>
             JSTOR
            </em>

            </em>

            <em>

            </em>

            </a>

             Strangers In the City: Reconfigurations of Space, Power, and Social Networks Within China&rsquo;s Floating Population
            </em>
            . Stanford: Stanford University Press, 2001. Print.

            </em>

          <h2>
           Keith Hampton (March 16)
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_1" id="content18321961">
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works by Keith Hampton
           </strong>
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            Hampton, Keith. "Grieving for a Lost Network: Collective Action in a Wired Suburb."
            <em>
             Information Society
            </em>
            19.5 (2003): 417.
            <em>
             Academic Search Complete
            </em>
            . Web. 11 March 2010.
            <br />
            <a href="http://0-search.ebscohost.com.library.muhlenberg.edu/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=11123354&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">

             American Behavioral Scientist
            </em>

            <em>

            </em>

          <div class="bi_text">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           Steve Roden (March 17)
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_1" id="content18321970">
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works by Steve Roden
           </strong>
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            Web page of Steve Roden. Retrieved March 17, 2010, from
            <a href="http://www.inbetweennoise.com/">
             http://www.inbetweennoise.com/
            </a>
            .
           </p>
          </blockquote>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works about Steve Roden
           </strong>
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            Green, Kate. "
            <a href="http://0-vnweb.hwwilsonweb.com.library.muhlenberg.edu/hww/jumpstart.jhtml?recid=0bc05f7a67b1790e3e62fef736e0394dc43176c37ff4897e0a6618b139eea3234bebb1ddccc1c61c&amp;fmt=P">
             Steve Roden and Stephen Vitiello: Lora Reynolds Gallery
            </a>
            ."
            <em>
             Modern Painters
            </em>
            19.10 (2008): 95.
            <em>
             Art Full Text
            </em>
            . Web. 17 Mar. 2010.
           </p>
           <p>
            Janku, Laura Richard. "
            <a href="http://0-search.ebscohost.com.library.muhlenberg.edu/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=17172857&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
             Steve Roden
            </a>
            ."
            <em>
             ArtUS
            </em>
            8 (2005): 24-25.
            <em>
             Academic Search Complete
            </em>
            . EBSCO. Web. 17 Mar. 2010.
           </p>
           <p>
            Kilston, Lyra. "
            <a href="http://0-vnweb.hwwilsonweb.com.library.muhlenberg.edu/hww/jumpstart.jhtml?recid=0bc05f7a67b1790e3e62fef736e0394dae96221d56c0899025d8fd03ee33bb35db7138f6f5528ef0&amp;fmt=P">
             Sound artists Steve Roden and Stephen Vitiello on transforming a field in Marfa, Texas, by way of sonic samples and the play of light
            </a>
            ."
            <em>
             Modern Painters
            </em>
            20.1 (2008): 112, 110.
            <em>
             Art Full Text
            </em>
            . Web. 17 Mar. 2010.
           </p>
           <p>
            Kofoed, Kristian. "
            <a href="http://0-vnweb.hwwilsonweb.com.library.muhlenberg.edu/hww/jumpstart.jhtml?recid=0bc05f7a67b1790e3e62fef736e0394dfc464085da367a4af8b5133fc2f15737f2aabe4e76ae2b59&amp;fmt=P">
             The Sound of Art: A Conversation with Steve Roden
            </a>
            ."
            <em>
             Artweek
            </em>
            34.8 (2003): 12, 29.
            <em>
             Art Full Text
            </em>
            . Web. 17 Mar. 2010.
           </p>
           <p>
            Schad, Ed. "
            <a href="http://0-vnweb.hwwilsonweb.com.library.muhlenberg.edu/hww/jumpstart.jhtml?recid=0bc05f7a67b1790e3e62fef736e0394d763f094b2f35eaa003ded8e13fd2da27805af1d519adaaa6&amp;fmt=P">
             Steve Roden
            </a>
            ."
            <em>
             Art Review (London, England)
            </em>
            Oct. 2008: 158.
            <em>
             OmniFile Full Text Mega
            </em>
            . Web. 17 Mar. 2010.
           </p>
           <p>
            Taft, Catherine. "
            <a href="http://0-vnweb.hwwilsonweb.com.library.muhlenberg.edu/hww/jumpstart.jhtml?recid=0bc05f7a67b1790e3e62fef736e0394dae96221d56c089903cefe70ba820d9d30255a5a3d403b8c5&amp;fmt=P">
             Before &amp; After Science
            </a>
            ."
            <em>
             Art Review (London, England)
            </em>
            May 2008: 139.
            <em>
             Art Full Text
            </em>
            . Web. 17 Mar. 2010.
           </p>
          </blockquote>
          <div id="boxatt18321970" class="boxatt">
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div id="wrapbox18321978">
        <div class="roundbox outerbox" id="18321978">
         <div class="roundbox headerbox" id="title18321978">
          <div class="bi_text">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           Edmund Mooney and Jonny Farrow (March 23)
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_1" id="content18321978">
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works by and about Edmund Mooney &amp; Jonny Farrow
           </strong>
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            &ldquo;Edmund Mooney.&rdquo;
            <em>
             www.edmundmooney.com
            </em>
            . 2010. Web. 19 March 2010.
            <a href="http://www.edmundmooney.com/">
             http://www.edmundmooney.com/
            </a>
           </p>
           <p>
            &ldquo;Jonny Farrow.&rdquo;
            <em>
             www.jonnyfarrow.net
            </em>
            . 2010. Web. 19 March 2010.
            <a href="http://jonnyfarrow.net/">
             http://jonnyfarrow.net/
            </a>
           </p>
           <p>
            Mooney, Edmund, Andrea Pollie, Jonny Farrow, and Gordon Hempton. &ldquo;Ear to the Ground.&rdquo;
            <em>
             Seed Magazine
            </em>
            . Web. 20 March 2010.
            <a href="http://seedmagazine.com/slideshow/ear_to_the_ground/">
             http://seedmagazine.com/slideshow/ear_to_the_ground/
            </a>
           </p>
           <p>
            &ldquo;Resume.&rdquo;
            <em>
             www.edmundmooney.com
            </em>
            . 2010. Web. 19 March 2010.
            <a href="http://www.edmundmooney.com/pages/contact-resume.htm">
             http://www.edmundmooney.com/pages/contact-resume.htm
            </a>
           </p>
           &ldquo;Work Samples.&rdquo;
           <em>
            www.jonnyfarrow.net
           </em>
           . 2010. Web. 19 March 2010.
           <a href="http://jonnyfarrow.net/">
            http://jonnyfarrow.net/
           </a>
          </blockquote>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Other Works about Soundwalks, Soundscapes, and Acoustic Ecology
           </strong>
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            Kern, Petra. &ldquo;Surrounded by Soundscapes - An Afternoon Talk with R. Murray Schafer.&rdquo;
            <em>
             Music Therapy Today
            </em>
            8.2 (18 July 2007). Web. 19 March 2010.
            <a href="http://www.musictherapyworld.de/modules/mmmagazine/showarticle.php?articletoshow=206">
             http://www.musictherapyworld.de/modules/mmmagazine/showarticle.php?articletoshow=206
            </a>
           </p>
           <p>
            Krause, Bernie. "The Loss of Natural Soundscapes."
            <em>
             Earth Island Journal
            </em>
            17.1 (2002): 27.
            <em>
             Academic Search Complete
            </em>
            . EBSCO. Web. 22 Mar. 2010.
            <a href="http://0-search.ebscohost.com.library.muhlenberg.edu/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=5930713&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
             http://0-search.ebscohost.com.library.muhlenberg.edu/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=5930713&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site
            </a>
           </p>
           <p>
            Lawson, Francesca Sborgi. "Being Audient: Similarities between Chinese Daoism and Western Acoustic Ecology."
            <em>
             Interdisciplinary Humanities
            </em>
            26.2 (2009): 21-30.
            <em>
             Academic Search Complete
            </em>
            . EBSCO. Web. 22 Mar. 2010.
            <a href="http://0-search.ebscohost.com.library.muhlenberg.edu/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=47222481&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
             http://0-search.ebscohost.com.library.muhlenberg.edu/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=47222481&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site
            </a>
           </p>
           <p>
            <em>
             <a href="http://www.cityinasoundwalk.org">
              www.cityinasoundwalk.org
             </a>
            </em>
            . 2010. Web. 19 March 2010.
            <a href="http://www.cityinasoundwalk.org/">
             http://www.cityinasoundwalk.org/
            </a>
           </p>
           <p>
            <em>
             <a href="http://www.nyacousticecology.org">
              www.nyacousticecology.org
             </a>
             .
            </em>
            2010. Web. 19 March 2010.
            <a href="http://www.nyacousticecology.org/">
             http://www.nyacousticecology.org/
            </a>
           </p>
           <p>
            <em>
             <a href="http://www.projectsoundwave.com">
              www.projectsoundwave.com
             </a>
            </em>
            . 2010. Web. 19 March 2010.
            <a href="http://www.projectsoundwave.com/index2.html">
             http://www.projectsoundwave.com/index2.html
            </a>
           </p>
           <p>
            <em>
             <a href="http://www.soundwalk.com">
              www.soundwalk.com
             </a>
             .
            </em>
            2010. Web. 19 March 2010.
            <a href="http://www.soundwalk.com/">
             http://www.soundwalk.com/
            </a>
           </p>
          </blockquote>
          <div id="boxatt18321978" class="boxatt">
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div id="wrapbox18322024">
        <div class="roundbox outerbox" id="18322024">
         <div class="roundbox headerbox" id="title18322024">
          <div class="bi_text">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           Additional resources about the ethics of space and power of place.
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_1" id="content18322024">
          <p>
           Pahl, J., et al (2007, May). The desire to acquire: or, why shopping malls are sites of religious violence.
           <em>
            The Martin Marty Center for the Advanced Study of Religion.
           </em>
           Retrieved July 22, 2009, from
           <a href="http://divinity.uchicago.edu/martycenter/publications/webforum/052007/">
            http://divinity.uchicago.edu/martycenter/publications/webforum/052007/
           </a>
          </p>
          <div id="boxatt18322024" class="boxatt">
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
